cellKey 0.17
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Introduction to the cellKey-Package
  • Changelog

Create perturbation parameters for continuous variables

ck_params_nums.Rd

This function allows to define perturbation parameters used to perturb cells in magnitude tables.

ck_params_nums(P = "top_contr", top_k = NULL, D, l, same_key = TRUE,
  use_zero_rkeys = FALSE)

Arguments

P

a character value defining the way to identify the magnifier, e.g which contributions/values in a cell should be the used in the perturbation procedure. Possible choices are:

  • top_contr: the k largest contributions are used. In this case, it is also required to specify argument top_k

  • mean: the (weighted) cellmean is used as starting point

  • range: the difference between largest and smallest contribution is used.

  • sum: the (weighted) cellvalue itself is used as starting point
top_k

it is ignored if P is different from top_contr. Otherwise,
D

maximum perturbation value
l

stepwidth parameter for computation of perturbation tables a integerish number >= 1 specifying the number of top contributions whose values should be perturbed.
same_key

(logical) should original cell key (TRUE) used for for finding perturbation values of the largest contributor to a cell or should a perturbation of the cellkey itself (FALSE) take place.
use_zero_rkeys

(logical) skalar defining if record keys of units not contributing to a specific numeric variables should be used (TRUE) or ignored (FALSE) when computing cell keys.

Value

an object suitable as input to ck_setup() for the perturbation of magnitude tables

Examples

ck_params_nums(D = 3, l = 0.5, P = "top_contr", top_k = 3)
#> $params
#> $params$P
#> [1] "top_contr"
#> 
#> $params$top_k
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> $params$stab
#>     i   j           p    kum_p_u    kum_p_o diff
#>  1: 0 0.0 1.000000000 0.00000000 1.00000000  0.0

ck_params_nums(D = 10, l = .5, P = "mean")
#> $params
